articles.title: What Disney's new content plan means for Marvel's future
articles.description: During a Disney earnings call, Bob Iger revealed the studio plans to 'reduce output' of Marvel movies and television shows to 'focus more on quality.' How does that affect the franchise moving forward?
articles.content:
No more "on your left." The Marvel Cinematic Universe is taking a breather after a hefty run of films and television shows. 
More than halfway into Phase 5 of the franchise, and amid greater convers… [+3384 chars]

articles.title: Sex scenes in movies are in rapid decline, study shows — here’s why
articles.description: Challengers might be a hit with a threesome, but nudity and sex in Hollywood movies has been down since 2000, as Marvel took over and #MeToo refocused attention.
